titles.title: Expediting the commencement of committee hearings during the remainder of the first session of the One Hundred Fourth Congress.

action.text: The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 104-424, by Mr. Goss.

calendar.text: Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 165.

action.text: Mr. Dreier asked unanimous consent that the resolution be laid on the table. Agreed to without objection.

bill.summary: 12/18/1995--Introduced. Waives, for the remainder of the first session of the 104th Congress, provisions of rule XI of the Rules of the House of Representatives requiring either the concurrence of the ranking minority member or a vote at a business meeting to commence a committee hearing sooner than one week after a public announcement of its date, place, and subject matter.
